alert.note: Alert for Eastern, Central El Paso County; Western El Paso County (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 9:02PM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Dona Ana and northwestern El Paso Counties through 830 PM MDT... At 802 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm over the Franklin Mountains, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... West El Paso, Central El Paso, Northeast El Paso, Chaparral, Santa Teresa, Anthony, Sunland Park, Anthony Gap, Canutillo, Westway, Fort Bliss, Vinton, Chamberino, La Union, Union Pacific Intermodal Terminal and Franklin Mountains State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 161 and 164. Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 1 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern, Central El Paso County; Western El Paso County
